question: Does tirasemtiv (CK-2017357) increase contractile force or calcium sensitivity in fast-twitch skeletal muscle fibers? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Binding selectively to the fast-skeletal-troponin complex, CK-2017357 slows the rate of calcium release from troponin C and sensitizes muscle to calcium.
content.source_2: In isolated rat extensor digitorum longus (fast-twitch) fibers, tirasemtiv (CK-2017357) produced no change in calcium sensitivity or twitch force across 0.03–10 μM, indicating a lack of effect on fast skeletal muscle.
content.source_3: We developed a small-molecule fast-skeletal-troponin activator, CK-2017357, as a means to increase muscle strength by amplifying the response of muscle when neural input is otherwise diminished secondary to neuromuscular disease.
content.source_4: Pharmacologic profiling showed negligible affinity of CK-2017357 for fast skeletal troponin C, with preferential binding to the slow-skeletal isoform; consistent with this, indices of fast-twitch performance were unchanged after exposure.
